newsitem.title: CHILE: Chilean shares end firm, eyes on economic data.
newsitem.headline: Chilean shares end firm, eyes on economic data.

text.p: Chilean blue chips closed higher with the opening depending on a welter of economic figures to be released by the Central Bank on Friday.
Investors hope the data will be more evidence the economy is slowing, which could lead to a cut in interest rates.
"The market is focusing on what will happen tomorrow with the Imacec (economic activity) figure," said one trader. "Investors believe it will reflect the depth of the credit-tightening."
The selective IPSA index ended up 0.14 percent at 98.36 points. The IGPA index firmed 0.08 percent to 5,388.98 points.
Volume remained light at 11 billion pesos.
On Friday, the bank will publish its monthly report including July trade figures and the Imacec index recording economic activity in June.
Analysts expect the Imacec index to show economic activity in June slowed to five percent from 5.6 percent in May.
Investors are hoping the slowdown in the economy may persuade the Central Bank to reduce interest rates before the year-end, said traders.
High local interest rates have held a grip on the bolsa for months with investors switching investments to fixed income paper, they said.
Risers included foresrt firm Masisa, up 0.99 percent at 205 pesos, steel-maker Cap, up 0.77 percent at 1,315 pesos and power utility Chilquinta which firmed 0.69 percent to 2,150 pesos.
Losers included drug firm LanChile, down 1.82 percent at 324 pesos, bottler Andina, down 0.44 percent at 2,260 pesos and glass-maker Cristales which shed 0.33 percent to 2,990 pesos.
